intro: Dichocarpum hagiangense, commonly known as the Hagiang rock fern, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of northern Vietnam. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves with a unique arrangement of leaflets. The plant typically grows in rocky and shaded environments, showcasing adaptations to its challenging habitat. Its botanical features include a short, creeping rhizome and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
